name: Acne and Rosacea
description: Inflammatory skin conditions causing pimples, redness, and irritation.
precautions: Avoid oily cosmetics, wash face regularly, avoid touching face.
medicines: Benzoyl peroxide, Salicylic acid, Topical antibiotics

name: Actinic Keratosis Basal Cell Carcinoma and other Malignant Lesions
description: Precancerous or cancerous skin lesions caused by prolonged sun exposure.
precautions: Avoid UV exposure, wear sunscreen, regular skin checkups.

name: Atopic Dermatitis
description: Chronic skin condition causing dry, itchy, and inflamed skin.
precautions: Keep skin moisturized, avoid allergens, use gentle soaps.

name: Bullous Disease
description: Autoimmune disorder causing blistering on the skin.
precautions: Avoid skin trauma, monitor blisters, consult dermatologist.

name: Cellulitis Impetigo and other Bacterial Infections
description: Bacterial infections of the skin that can cause redness, swelling, and pus.
precautions: Keep wounds clean, avoid sharing personal items, seek medical attention.

name: Eczema
description: A group of conditions causing itchy, inflamed skin.
precautions: Use fragrance-free moisturizers, avoid scratching.

name: Exanthems and Drug Eruptions
description: Skin rashes caused by infections or reactions to medications.
precautions: Avoid known allergens, consult healthcare provider before taking new medications.

name: Hair Loss Photos Alopecia and other Hair Diseases
description: Hair loss disorders leading to thinning or bald patches on the scalp.
precautions: Avoid tight hairstyles, reduce stress, eat a balanced diet.

name: Herpes HPV and other STDs
description: Viral infections causing skin blisters or lesions.
precautions: Practice safe sex, avoid contact with infected areas.

name: Light Diseases and Disorders of Pigmentation
description: Conditions affecting skin pigmentation such as vitiligo or melasma.
precautions: Use sunscreen, avoid tanning, follow dermatological advice.

name: Lupus and other Connective Tissue Diseases
description: Autoimmune diseases causing inflammation in skin and other tissues.
precautions: Avoid sun exposure, manage stress, adhere to medication.

name: Melanoma Skin Cancer Nevi and Moles
description: Cancerous skin growths, often appearing as irregular moles.
precautions: Avoid excessive sun exposure, use sunscreen, monitor moles.

name: Nail Fungus and other Nail Disease
description: Fungal infections of the nail causing discoloration and thickening.
precautions: Keep nails clean and dry, avoid sharing nail tools.

name: Poison Ivy Photos and other Contact Dermatitis
description: Skin irritation caused by contact with allergens or irritants.
precautions: Avoid known irritants, wear protective clothing.

name: Psoriasis pictures Lichen Planus and Related Diseases
description: Chronic inflammatory skin diseases causing scaling and redness.
precautions: Moisturize regularly, avoid stress triggers.

name: Scabies Lyme Disease and other Infestations and Bites
description: Skin reactions from insect bites or infestations like mites.
precautions: Maintain hygiene, avoid sharing clothing or bedding.

name: Seborrheic Keratoses and other Benign Tumors
description: Non-cancerous skin growths that may look like warts or moles.
precautions: Monitor for changes, avoid self-treatment.

name: Systemic Disease
description: Diseases affecting multiple organs and may show skin symptoms.
precautions: Follow systemic disease treatment plan, regular checkups.

name: Tinea Ringworm Candidiasis and other Fungal Infections
description: Fungal infections affecting skin, nails, and scalp.
precautions: Keep skin dry, avoid sharing personal items.

name: Urticaria Hives
description: Red, itchy welts that result from skin reactions.
precautions: Identify and avoid triggers (foods, medications).

name: Vascular Tumors
description: Abnormal growths of blood vessels in the skin.
precautions: Monitor growths, avoid trauma to affected area.

name: Vasculitis Photos
description: Inflammation of blood vessels causing skin discoloration or sores.
precautions: Manage underlying condition, avoid infections.

name: Warts Molluscum and other Viral Infections
description: Skin infections caused by viruses resulting in growths or bumps.
precautions: Avoid touching warts, use personal hygiene products.
